comment.shortText:
Necessary typing for RefactorSessionChainable static methods
The Chainable Refactor interface

tags.text: This is not intended to be instantiated directly. Use refactor() to create your instances.

comment.shortText: Sub-query from selected nodes
Inserts the result of `replacer` after the selected statement.

tags.text: Only works on Statement nodes.

comment.text: `string` | Shift `Node` | `(node) => string | Node`: Replaces a node with the result of the replacer parameter

comment.shortText: Finds the closest parent node that matches the passed selector.
Generates JavaScript source for the first selected node.
Finds the declaration for the selected Identifier nodes.

tags.text: Note: Returns a list of Declaration objects for each selected node, not a shift-refactor query object.

comment.shortText: Delete nodes
Finds node via the passed iterator iterator
Finds an expression that closely matches the passed source.

tags.text: Used for selecting nodes by source pattern instead of query. The passed source is parsed as a Script and the first statement is expected to be an ExpressionStatement.Matching is done by matching the properties of the parsed statement, ignoring additional properties/nodes in the source tree.

comment.shortText: Finds a statement that matches the passed source.

tags.text: Used for selecting nodes by source pattern vs query. The passed source is parsed as a Script and the first statement alone is used as the statement to match. Matching is done by matching the properties of the parsed statement, ignoring additional properties/nodes in the source tree.

comment.shortText: Finds and selects a single node, throwing an error if zero or more than one is found.

tags.text: This is useful for when you want to target a single node but aren't sure how specific your query needs to be to target that node and only that node.

comment.shortText: Returns the first node in the list
Iterate over selected nodes
Get selected node at index.

`console.log()`s the selected nodes. Useful for inserting into a chain to see what
nodes you are working with.
Looks up the Variable from the passed identifier node

tags.text: Returns `Variable` objects from shift-scope, that contain all the references and declarations for a program variable.

comment.shortText: Looks up Variables by name.

tags.text: There may be multiple across a program. Variable lookup operates on the global program state. This method ignores selected nodes.

comment.shortText: Transform selected nodes via passed iterator
Retrieve parent node(s)
Inserts the result of `replacer` before the selected statement.

tags.text: Only works on Statement nodes.

comment.text: `string` | Shift `Node` | `(node) => string | Node`: Replaces a node with the result of the replacer parameter

comment.shortText: Generates JavaScript source for the first selected node.
Sub-query from selected nodes

tags.text: synonym for .$()

comment.shortText: Finds the references for the selected Identifier nodes.

tags.text: Note: Returns a list of Reference objects for each selected node, not a shift-refactor query object.

comment.shortText: Rename all references to the first selected node to the passed name.

tags.text: Uses the selected node as the target, but affects the global state.

comment.shortText: Replace selected node with the result of the replacer parameter
Async version of .replace() that supports asynchronous replacer functions
Recursively replaces child nodes until no nodes have been replaced.
JSON-ifies the current selected nodes.
Refactor query object type
Refactor query objects can take a string, a single node, or a list of nodes as input
Create a refactor query object.

tags.text: This function assumes that it is being passed complete JavaScript source or a *root* AST node (Script or Module) so that it can create and maintain global state.
